text: in Afghanistan every Combat Outpost
seems to have at least one dog you could
call them strays but every dog here
seems to be a stray of some kind
moving from family to family the village
to village American soldiers give them
food and affection and the dog stick
around this is our dog blondi as the
germans called her she was after that
she chilled out with us many are
aggressive toward Afghans but loving
with American soldiers the pregnant dog
she has been around here I think ever
since we got here - I call her waggles
some have had their ears cut off by
previous owners
so other dogs can't grab or tear them in
fights the dogs here I don't know how
they're treated when we're not here as
far as coalition forces aren't here but
uh I get treated pretty well we get
pretty spoiled when over a rail since
blondie started hanging around she's
gained weight and taken to going with
the soldiers on patrols recently we went
on a night patrol lo and behold there
she was she pretty much every time I
would get up and go check on all of my
guys she would follow me around unless
somebody else was already there like
scratching her ear or something she
would stay with him the most part she
was right there checking the lines with
me making sure all my guys were awake
cold security it's kind of cool with
dogs like blondie can help with security
warning the soldiers when someone's
approaching but if they bark on night
patrols they can give away the soldiers
location and commanders don't like them
because they carry disease and leave
droppings everywhere that typically
order them removed if they spot them
sometimes the dogs get themselves into
trouble
blondie ended up getting aggressive with
some Afghan children and was shot by
German soldiers
a bit upset about it but
it's just going to be biting kids
there's no other way to control them
if it had to happen around the same time
waggles heavy wagons having babies who's
kind of the whole circle of life thing I
haven't seen him yet
okay she's got a pretty low go hidden
underneath for the patios but I'm sure
here a few weeks they'll be out walking
around probably wagon
